channel.title: Flat four - UK indie, DIY and experimental radio
channel.description: UK internet radio that supports independent music.
channel.copyright: Copyright: The audio files featured here are copyrighted, and you do not have the right to re-publish them, so please don't circulate any of the MP3 files without permission. (Please feel free to link to the downloads from our server; but ideally please link people to http://www.flatfourradio.co.uk or link/syndicate our RSS feed.) The copyright in the programmes is held by Flat Four Radio. Where music is featured, copyright remains with the copyright holders of the recorded work.

item.title: Cardiff walk, Sophia Gardens to the Cathedral
item.description: An audio journey through the leafier bits of Cardiff, from Sophia Gardens through to the Cathedral, meeting a couple of people along the way. Take 20 minutes out for a stroll...

item.title: The Ock Show: 15
The Ock Show: 14
Icelandic Insults
item.description: Some Icelanders tell us how to insult people in Icelandic! (Recordings made in Reykjavik, 2003)

item.title: Beatbox Selection Box
item.description: Dan (aka MCLD) brings you a pile of new beatbox music, coming 100% from the mouth. Includes: Bigg Taj - Trihedral - yasSon - mastaMIC - Lex-Beats - semerock - GRB - Eljazz M - plus a jam featuring MCLD, Drops, Samuel, and Fat Tony.

item.title: UK Stitch 'n' Bitch Day 2007
item.description:
Comedy act Girl and Dean talk about knitting a pair of headphones and glimpsing their hero, Debbie Stoller. Debbie, who's the editor of Bust magazine and author of the Stitch 'n' Bitch books, reckons knitting a rubbish jumper could lead to murder. You have been warned. Meanwhile, Felicity Ford shows us her favourite knitted walking stick cosies and Peter Wyton performs his poem about getting chucked out of a pub... for knitting.

Recorded at the UK's first Stitch 'n' Bitch Day in November 2007. (Features: Girl and Dean · Debbie Stoller · The Missability Radio Show · Peter Wyton)

item.title: The Ock Show: 13
item.description: Tracklisting: (1) Coda - Not Enough; (2) Ultrafoetus - Extra Words For Matt; (3) Cartridge - Fooling Around; (4) Shalmaneser - Cut To Close Up Of Self-Destruct Timer; (5) Iago - Drag; (6) Cariad - Transit; (7) The Acorahs - Traitors. www.flatfourradio.co.uk

item.title: The Ock Show: 12
item.description: Tracklisting: (1) YouNoGoDie - First Rope; (2) Sicknote - Get On The Bus; (3) Circum Elements - In A Room; (4) Throcke - The Unanswerable; (5) Ikaruga - Fragile; (6) ZX Industries - 7. www.flatfourradio.co.uk

item.title: Copenhagen, August 2007
item.description: Dan records some dictaphonic impressions of Copenhagen.

item.title: audiopop 18
item.description:
Philippa talks to Richard from the recently reformed 90s indie heroes, Midget, and plays loads of brilliant tracks by new and unsigned bands.
Sam and Me | Weevil Knievel | Midget | Encyclopedia | Alcopop! | Leader | Zine Wiki | Marla Singer | Soular | The Standards

item.title: audiopop 17
item.description:
Philippa gets excited about pop band, The Hussy's, and chats to their drummer, Gordy. Plus lots more new and unsigned music to brighten your day.
Desdemona | actionforce | Lardpony | Stressed Records | The Hussy's | The Girl With the Replaceable Head

item.title: Ladyfest Cardiff programme (part 1)
item.description: Dan and Philippa's report on Ladyfest Cardiff 2006 features lots of exclusive and brilliant live music. There's also poetry, CDs, reviews of the zines we bought at the fest, and lots of chit-chat about what went on. (We have more Ladyfest sounds too!) Get a flavour of this action-packed DIY festival.

item.title: Ladyfest Cardiff programme (part 2)
item.description: Dan and Philippa's report on Ladyfest Cardiff 2006 features lots of exclusive and brilliant live music. There's also poetry, CDs, reviews of the zines we bought at the fest, and lots of chit-chat about what went on. (We have more Ladyfest sounds too!) Get a flavour of this action-packed DIY festival.

item.title: The Buzz - Live at Ladyfest Cardiff 2006
item.description: For more info see our Ladyfest page...

item.title: Manic Cough - Live at Ladyfest Cardiff 2006
item.description: For more info see our Ladyfest page...

item.title: Candy Panic Attack - Live at Ladyfest Cardiff 2006
item.description: Candy Panic Attack recorded live at the Chapter Arts Centre as part of Ladyfest Cardiff 2006. This live recording brings you some of the flavour of the gig, but unfortunately not the pirate costumes. For more info see our Ladyfest page...

item.title: audiopop 16
item.description:
Philippa presents another half hour of independent music, including a live session from Fleeing New York.

Fairview | Weekend | The Clerks | Fleeing New York | Stand Out Riot | Artificial Intelligence in Texas

item.title: audiopop 15
item.description:
Philippa presents half an hour of independent music. Dan talks to Manda Rin, formerly of Bis and now with a fantastic new band - data Panik. Plus find out how to exchange gig tickets at face value with Richard from the Scarlet Mist website.
The Disco King | 1,2,3 and the Fours | Scarlet Mist | My Secret Life | Spoonchatter | data Panik | Tokyo Adventures

item.title: Akrasi - Live at Ladyfest Cardiff
item.description: We present a gorgeous live set from London-based and trip-hop-tinged Akrasi. This set was recorded live at Ladyfest Cardiff 2006, in the Chapter Arts Centre.

item.title: An Introduction to The Bellerophon
item.description: Flat Four is pleased to present an introduction to the music of Lancaster's premier industrial-ambient collective, The Bellerophon. An introduction featuring Bellerophon member Lucy is followed by tracks taken from their "More Songs" LP.

item.title: Oddmusic 15: Baroqtronica
item.description: Performances from a unique concert called "Baroqtronica" in which harpsichord and recorder were paired with computer synthesis methods. Featuring compositions by Nick Collins and Julio d'Escrivan, and an interview with Nick Collins on his machine-listening research.

item.title: The Ock Show: 11
item.description: Tracklisting: (1) Andrew Octopus - Sudanese Hackers; (2) The Middle Finger - 5am Eternal; (3) Everybody Loves Irene - Memento Mori; (4) Anthony Xavier - Imagine; (5) Cagey House - The Shnay Speaks; (6) goto80 - Llama Warning

item.title: The Dega Breaks - Live - at Curious Generation
item.description: Recorded at a Curious Generation live event during May 2005, this is a great live set from the fantastic unsigned band The Dega Breaks. (That's what they're called now - at the time they were called The Flight Scare.)

item.title: Oddmusic 14
item.description: In this episode of the programme about unusual ways to make music, Dan hears some excellent percussion music made out of balloons, and has a go at making balloon-drums himself. Also, the sounds of a dying Mac computer; algorithmic ring-tones; and synchronised drum/synth action from Duracell.

item.title: audiopop 14
item.description: Philippa plays new indie for you to fall in love with! Plus Dan talks to Clearlake about their new album, Amber.??The Atoms | The Poundstretchers | The Holloways | LostAlone | Clearlake | Comeg | The Polaroids | The Ashleigh Coffee Morning Band | Molloy

item.title: Afrirampo - Live - at Ladyfest Brighton
item.description: Afrirampo describe themselves on their website as:"Naked rock!!!!! Naked soul!!! Red red strong red dress!! Freeeeeeeeedam paradice rock! Jump! With improvisation. Sooo fantastic & wild performance ! wowowowowowowowowwoooooooooooooooooowwwwwwwww!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"We say: Two shouting Japanese women dismantle a drum kit and reassemble it in the audience - without missing a beat. How many other live gigs can promise you that?

item.title: Chiptunes: Nintendo Music
item.description: Flat Four has been looking into the world of music made on "retro" computers - the models of computer produced in the early 80s. These computers have limited sound capabilities, and what with human nature being the way it is, that seems to have inspired lots of musicians to work hard at playing with and challenging those limitations, and making a wealth of innovative music in the process. The programmes feature interviews with some of the original "gods" of 8-bit music, as well as members of the modern "demo scene", and other people who have decided that these retro sounds are where it's at. And even more, the programmes feature lots and lots of really excellent music. Beat that!

item.title: Oddmusic 13
item.description: The programme about unusual ways to make music returns with a special edition. Dan interviews Paul Moore of "Ukeleles for Peace", a unique project using odd music to actually bring about some change in the world. Plus some other delightful and weird music - electric football fields from GurdonArk, and one-man-band Philip Roebuck.

item.title: audiopop 13
item.description: Tracklisting: (1) Heifervescent - We Got To Plug You In; (2)Colurblind - It Took So Long; (3) Mascot Fight - Thinking in French;(4) Patchwork Grace - Doll's House; (5) Pocket Gods - Shark; (6)Colours Run - Beautiful Waste of Time; (7) Jellys Last Jam - All TheGlory; (8) Plastik - He Comes to Take Her Outside. * Win a CD! E-mail philippa[-at-]flatfourradio.co.uk

item.title: Ladyfest Brighton
item.description: A special report on the Ladyfest Brighton festival. Featuring music from some of the best bands we saw (Con Mun Gos, Smartypants, Theoretical Girl, and Fake Valerie Action), plus a selection of zines, and a Riot Grrrl discussion with two of the founders of the Riot Grrrl movement - Allison Wolfe and Toby Vail. Hear some excellent new music and get a flavour of the festival.

item.title: The Ock Show: 10
item.description: Tracklisting: (1) The Atari Star - Starve a Fever; (2) Untitled - Shub; (3) Midnight Moth - Che; (4) Manami-N - Something's Missing In Me; (5) opp1 - I Like Cigarette Butts and Cannot Lie; (6) Black Bats - Kill Kill Kill.

item.title: Chiptunes: Commodore Music
item.description: Flat Four has been looking into the world of music made on "retro" computers - the models of computer produced in the early 80s. These computers have limited sound capabilities, and what with human nature being the way it is, that seems to have inspired lots of musicians to work hard at playing with and challenging those limitations, and making a wealth of innovative music in the process. The programmes feature interviews with some of the original "gods" of 8-bit music, as well as members of the modern "demo scene", and other people who have decided that these retro sounds are where it's at. And even more, the programmes feature lots and lots of really excellent music. Beat that!

item.title: Auden Prim - Live - at the Marquee Club
item.description: Auden Prim could be one of the best new bands in the world, never mind the UK. Hailing from Norway originally, but then deciding that Liverpool would be a fun place to base themselves, they perform a blistering and well-honed set - as evidenced by this recording from the launch event for the Curious Generation nights.

item.title: The Ock Show: 9
item.description: Tracklisting: "wawar" by Sharopolis, "untitled" by Shub, "Undergone" by LÃ­kn, "It's Only A Joke" by Maisie and the Incredible Strange Choir of Paracuwaii

item.title: The Ock Show: 8
item.description:
Tracklisting:
I Put Ma Spixe Up Schoolboy Eric www.thembuzz.co.uk/music/music.htm
A New Song Scarnella www.carlabozulich.com
Work Out To Kill Beyond Pink www.beyondpink.tk

Hell Is Other People The Lonely Band www.thelonelyband.com
Girl Beer The Hazzards www.ukesofhazzard.com

item.title: Eric and the Bunny Boilers - Live - at the Marquee Club
item.description: Here's a set from raunchy post-punk Glasgow quartet Eric and the Bunny Boilers. This was recorded at the Marquee Club in London, on the launch event for the "Curious Generation" nights.

item.title: Flat Four Sample Challenge - Part 2
item.description: In Summer 2004 Flat Four issued a challenge to lots of interesting artists and producers that we know - to take a set of audio samples and work them into something fantastic. And they responded brilliantly...

item.title: Chiptunes: Atari Music
item.description: Flat Four has been looking into the world of music made on "retro" computers - the models of computer produced in the early 80s. These computers have limited sound capabilities, and what with human nature being the way it is, that seems to have inspired lots of musicians to work hard at playing with and challenging those limitations, and making a wealth of innovative music in the process. The programmes feature interviews with some of the original "gods" of 8-bit music, as well as members of the modern "demo scene", and other people who have decided that these retro sounds are where it's at. And even more, the programmes feature lots and lots of really excellent music. Beat that!

item.title: Flat Four Sample Challenge - Part 1
item.description: In Summer 2004 Flat Four issued a challenge to lots of interesting artists and producers that we know - to take a set of audio samples and work them into something fantastic. And they responded brilliantly...

item.title: Chiptunes: ZX Spectrum Music
item.description:
Flat Four has been looking into the world of music made on "retro" computers - the models of computer produced in the early 80s. These computers have limited sound capabilities, and what with human nature being the way it is, that seems to have inspired lots of musicians to work hard at playing with and challenging those limitations, and making a wealth of innovative music in the process.
The programmes feature interviews with some of the original "gods" of 8-bit music, as well as members of the modern "demo scene", and other people who have decided that these retro sounds are where it's at. And even more, the programmes feature lots and lots of really excellent music. Beat that!

item.title: April 12th
item.description: A documentary tribute to the anti-war protest marches which took place around the world on April 12th 2003, during the build up to Gulf War II. All the sounds in this piece were recorded on the London demo that day. The recording captures the enthusiasm and the motivation in the protesters and speakers' own words, and the exuberance of the marching drums that accompanied them.

item.title: Oddmusic, programme 3
item.description: The programme about music made with unusual instruments or methods. This episode features, among other things: an electric thumb-piano played with an electric bow; a chaotic computer algorithm; and the sampled sounds of someone destroying things he doesn't like.

item.title: Shub live
item.description: Performed live at MCLD's party 5/6/2003, this set features recorded tunes, sound-desk manipulation, and piano improvisation. It's dead good.

item.title: Z Lab Transported - Paul Granjon
item.description: Paul Granjon is an inventor working in Cardiff. He spends his days concocting bizarre robotic devices for all kinds of silly and thought-provoking purposes. Hear him talk about many of his creations, and present a live show featuring a selection of them!

item.title: Oddmusic, programme 2
item.description: The second episode of Dan's oddmusic programme features bamboo saxophones, the "ouijitar", some amazing acappella, and more.

item.title: Oddmusic, programme 1
item.description: The first ever episode of Dan's now-legendary programme about music made with unusual instruments and/or methods. This one features 6 brilliant pieces of music, including some circuit-bending, some electric kalimba, some household objects, and more...
